File /std/basic/light.c

This method handles the light changing and control.

Written by Pinkfish

Parameters:

This method tells us that the light levels have changed and should be recalculated when queried.

new_recalc_light
varargs void new_recalc_light()

query_light
int query_light()
This returns the total light level of the object. This includes the light levels of anything that happens to be inside us.

Returns:
current light level
See also:
query_my_light() and set_light()
query_light_needs_inform
int query_light_needs_inform()
query_my_light
int query_my_light()
This method returns the light associated with this object. This does not count the light levels of anything inside us.

query_opaque
int query_opaque()
This method checks to see if the object is opaque or not.

Returns:
1 if it is opaque, 0 if not
remove_inform_light_change
void remove_inform_light_change(object ob)
This method removes an object from the current list of things to be informed of a light change.

Parameters:
ob - the object to remove from the inform list
reset_opaque
void reset_opaque()
This method makes the object transparent (default). This means that the light from items inside does escape.

See also:
set_opaque() and set_light()
set_light
int set_light(int number)
This sets the current light level. This method calls adjust_light() with the correct value to set the light level.

Light Levels:
Magically Darkened Room 0-
Absolutely Dark Room 0
Standard Dark Room 5
Dimly Lit Room 20
Mine Shaft with Candles 30
Partially Lit Room 50
Well Lit Room 60
Shaded Forest 60
Brightly Lit Room 80
Direct Sunlight 100
Explosion or flash 200+

Parameters:
number - The new light level.
See also:
query_my_light() and query_light()
set_opaque
void set_opaque()
This method makes this object opaque. This means that light does not escpae from it.

See also:
not_obscured_object() and set_light()
